title: Wrong id in log objects when using getPastLogs API

labels.name: TeamRevenant
labels.description: GH issues worked on by Revenant Team

body:
### Description When we execute `getPastLogs` API, it seems that Besu returns wrong value for the `id` field in every returned log object. The same thing happens when using `getTransactionReceipt` API. ### Steps to Reproduce (Bug) 1. Download the following file and untar it: [test_log_id.tar.gz](https://github.com/hyperledger/besu/files/9295205/test_log_id.tar.gz) 2. Execute Besu binary with the following flags: `besu --data-path test_log_id/data-besu --genesis-file test_log_id/besu.json --rpc-http-port 8549 --rpc-http-enabled --rpc-http-api ETH --network-id 15 --discovery-enabled false` 3. Execute the test case file: `node test1.js` **Expected behavior:** All other client implementations return the following result: 
[{..., "id": "log_e92989bc"},
 {..., "id": "log_f02e3690"},
 {..., "id": "log_2312ee27"},
 {..., "id": "log_deff5d41"}, 
 {..., "id": "log_0d27fabe"}, ...]
**Actual behavior:** Only Besu returns the following result: 
[{..., "id": "log_207bb0d1"},
 {..., "id": "log_f02e3690"},
 {..., "id": "log_840ba6f4"},
 {..., "id": "log_3a16747a"}, 
 {..., "id": "log_1344d910"}, ...]
**Frequency:** Always ### Versions (Add all that apply) * Software version: besu/v22.4.4/linux-x86_64/openjdk-java-16 * OS Name & Version: Ubuntu 20.04.4 LTS * Node.js / web3.js Versions: v16.15.0 / v1.7.3

I have been testing about this bug, trying to reproduce it in 2 cases - 

1. Connected Geth and Besu to Goerli Testnet and ran the getPastLogs, and compared the results
2. Created my own private Testnet using Besu and Geth clients and CLIQUE consensus, ran the getPastLogs, and compared the results.

**1st Case -** 
GetPastLogs from Block 4350000 to 4350001. 

**2nd Case -** 
GetPastLogs from Block 0 to latest on address - "0x00Be1A0db3eb8471e5FE41e35288E4b0DDa42D80".

[priv-testnet.zip](https://github.com/hyperledger/besu/files/10917243/priv-testnet.zip)

Steps to start and sync the network with all nodes running and reproduce the results - 

1. Download and uncompress the file above.
2. `cd clique-testnet-besu/node1`
3. `besu --data-path=data --genesis-file=../cliqueGenesis.json --network-id 1106 --rpc-http-enabled --rpc-http-api=ETH,NET,CLIQUE --host-allowlist="*" --rpc-http-cors-origins="all"`
4. `cd clique-testnet-besu/node2`
5. `besu --data-path=data --genesis-file=../cliqueGenesis.json --bootnodes=enode://ad347c9d87ec29cdf3179269f342495afae88b72285a0fadb3630f703a46a3b5e3cf67414915841fce9fd7f07eb0e9a35874b426c793018fcf05787f0eb8bd9e@127.0.0.1:30303 --network-id 1106 --p2p-port=30304 --rpc-http-enabled --rpc-http-api=ETH,NET,CLIQUE --host-allowlist="*" --rpc-http-cors-origins="all" --rpc-http-port=8546`
6. `cd clique-testnet-besu/node3`
7. `besu --data-path=data --genesis-file=../cliqueGenesis.json --bootnodes=enode://ad347c9d87ec29cdf3179269f342495afae88b72285a0fadb3630f703a46a3b5e3cf67414915841fce9fd7f07eb0e9a35874b426c793018fcf05787f0eb8bd9e@127.0.0.1:30303 --network-id 1106 --p2p-port=30305 --rpc-http-enabled --rpc-http-api=ETH,NET,CLIQUE --host-allowlist="*" --rpc-http-cors-origins="all" --rpc-http-port=8547`
8. `cd clique-testnet-geth/`
9. `geth  --port 30306 --http --http.corsdomain="https://remix.ethereum.org" --http.api web3,eth,debug,personal,net --vmdebug --networkid 1106 --datadir data --http.port 8548 --syncmode full --bootnodes enode://ad347c9d87ec29cdf3179269f342495afae88b72285a0fadb3630f703a46a3b5e3cf67414915841fce9fd7f07eb0e9a35874b426c793018fcf05787f0eb8bd9e@127.0.0.1:30303`
10. Besu RPC endpoint - `http://localhost:8546`
11. Geth RPC endpoint - `http://localhost:8548`


Results -

@macfarla 
We can close this issue, as it is not reproducible in the latest Besu (23.1.0)
